Definition: The type of users that will be reviewing and reacting to the KPIs/ measures
Purpose: to help identify which measures and level of detail is required for reporting based on audience type

Definition: The background in which the organisation is operating, normally framed as a challenge. Our costs are increasing, we cannot retain our staff, our carbon footprint is increasing
Purpose: To provide a context for the setting of a specific goal

Definition: The method of obtaining data from source
Raw data collected manually or automatically specific to a single variable.
The method by which a value has been determined
Describes what the organisation expects to accomplish over a specific period of time. This can be qualitative or quantitative
The information specified by audience that they need  in order to be able to understand how the organisation is progressing with regards to a particular goal or target.
The action of explaining the meaning of something.
A measure whose value is assessed against a target, reflects business performance and should support decision making
The method by which a measurement has been taken
A variable composed of one or more measurements
Purpose: to represent data in a meaningful and interpretable way

Definition: The role responsible for commissining the KPI
The frequency with which the KPI is reported to the audience
Source of data points .e.g. the record  (a system, a file location,) of themeasurable thing
Purpose: to identify common sources between measures

Definition: Quantifiable representation of the goal or part of the goal
A quantity or description used to define a measure/ metric type
Purpose: To provide context to a measure and identify which metrics can be compared

Definition: The length of time during which a target is valid. This should have a start date and a review date.
relates measure to a value for purposes of comparison
